loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro se caracteriza por ser una persona muy entusiasta y servicial. Tiene 58 años y con su primera pareja tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales vive con tres; vive con su actual pareja Remigia, de 42 años, con quien no tiene hijos.

De la agricultura le gusta todo, más aún porque sabe que la buena producción de sus cosechas dependen de él y de los cuidados que le brinda a sus tierras. Pedro lleva 40 años dedicado a cultivar café y plátanos; paralelamente tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles que administra su pareja.
Su actividad es muy rentable porque le permitió brindarle una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, pero siente que aún tiene un compromiso con sus hijos, por eso planea comprar siete hectáreas de terreno agrícola cerca a su vivienda, donde cultivará maíz, yuca y plátanos para después darle en herencia a sus hijos.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y cuenta que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas que conoce desde hace muchos años atrás y respalda su labor. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará 5 sacos de fertilizante para nivelar sus plantaciones, asimismo guardará parte del dinero para pagar el jornal de los operarios que contratará.
texts.en:
Pedro is known for being an enthusiastic and helpful person. He is 58 years old and had six children with his first wife. Three of his children live with him. Pedro is now married to Remigia, age 42, but they do not have any children together.

He enjoys everything about farming, even more so because he knows that a good harvest is dependent on him and the care he provides to the land. Pedro has been growing coffee and bananas for 40 years. At the same time, he owns a grocery store that his wife manages. His farming activities have been very profitable since they provide an adequate quality of life for his family. However, he still feels he has a commitment to his children, so he plans to buy seven hectares of farmland near his home where he will grow corn, cassava, and bananas and then later give it to them as an inheritance.

This is his third loan with MFP. Pedro says he enjoys working with his Communal Bank because the members are people who have known him for many years and respect his work. With the loan of 1500 PEN that he requested, Pedro will buy five sacks of fertilizer for his crops. He will also set aside part of the money to pay the workers he plans to hire.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & pay his workers

loans.name: Pony

texts.es:
Pony, de 35 años, es un hombre soltero, vive en la casa de su madre, de 71 años, a quien cuida porque es una persona que ya no puede valerse por sí sola.

En los terrenos de su madre, él planta café desde muy niño, actividad que realiza sólo, sin la ayuda de ningún familiar, pero para la plantación, limpieza y cosecha contrata operarios.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor es tener limpios sus terrenos, mientras por otro lado, le desagrada que a pesar de los esfuerzos que realizó la cosecha se retrase, como en la campaña anterior donde no pudo recolectar a tiempo el café porque no estaban desarrollados.
Su actividad le es muy rentable porque le permite vivir cómodamente, sin pasar necesidades, además está ahorrando para comprar una casa propia en la ciudad, así como instalar un vivero para que renueve constantemente sus plantas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y asegura que le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque está integrado por personas muy compresivas y exigentes en los pagos, que le enseñan a ser responsable. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará 6 sacos de fertilizantes y dos mil plantas de café para renovar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Pony, 35, is a single man. He lives in his 71-year-old mother's house and takes care of her because she is a person who can no longer fend for herself. Since he was very young he has planted coffee on his mother's land. He does this alone, without the help of any relatives, but for planting, clearing the land and harvesting he uses hired hands. What Pony likes best is to have the land cleared, while on the other hand, it bothers him that despite all his effort the harvest can be delayed, like last season when he couldn't harvest the coffee on time because the beans weren't ripe. His work is very profitable for him because it allows him to live comfortably, without lacking necessities. Besides this, he is saving to buy his own house in the city and install a nursery so he can constantly renew his plants. This is the second loan he has had with MFP, and he states that he likes to work with his communal bank because it is formed by very kind people who are strict about payments, and they teach him to be responsible. With the 2,000 new soles he is asking for, Pony will buy six sacks of fertilizer and 2,000 coffee plants to renew his crop.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and coffee plants

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es:
Henry de 44 años de edad es casado con la profesora Ginna Montiel con quien tiene un hijo de nombre Jerry de 16 años de edad el cual esta estudiando su primer año de la carrera Ingenieria en Sistemas. Henry trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito a AFODENIC con el proposito de cercar su propiedad, pues tanto el y su esposa trabajan todo el dia y la casa permanece sola, entonces desean brindar mayor seguridad a la propiedad.  Pretende hacer los arranques con piedra cantera y el resto con malla, pues es un poco mas economico.  

El mayor deseo de Henry es poder tener su casa bonita, con las condiciones necesarias y brindarle a su familia mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Henry is 44 years old and is married to a teacher, Ginna Montiel. They have one son, Jerry, who is 16 years old and is in is first year of course work for Systems Engineering. Henry has been working for the mayor's office of Juigalpa for 1 year. He is requesting his 1st credit with AFODENIC for the purpose of fencing in his property. Both he and his wife work all day while the house is empty. They want more security for their property. He plans to start with quarried rock and then do the rest with mesh, which is a little less expensive. Henry's greatest desire to to have a nice home, with the proper conditions, and to offer his family more security.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fence in property

loans.name: Rober

texts.es:
Rober es un joven soltero y emprendedor de 22 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su hermano mayor. Sus padres viajaron a Lima (capital del Perú), para descansar de la chacra.

Plátano, frutas cítricas y café son los productos que cultiva Rober en sus terrenos propios con la ayuda de su hermano, quien le enseña las técnicas agrícolas para mejorar su producción. En la agricultura lleva 4 años y le gusta estar pendiente del buen desarrollo de los frutos, sin embargo le incomoda tener que trasladarlos desde las chacras, ya que son muy pesados.
Su oficio es muy rentable porque le permite vivir cómodamente y ahorrar para algunos imprevistos futuros, además quiere construir su casa en la ciudad para que pueda tener su propia familia. Con el tiempo, quiere comprar más terrenos e incrementar su producción cafetalera.

Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP y siempre está pendiente de las decisiones que toma su banco comunal como grupo, ya que es secretario de la junta directiva. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita comprará 6 sacos de fertilizante, además de una macheteadota (herramienta que sirve para retirar la maleza de los terrenos), que le facilite el trabajo.
texts.en:
Rober is a single, enterprising, young man of 22. He lives in his own home with his older brother. His parents went to Lima (the capital of Perú) to take a break from the farm. With the help of his brother, Rober cultivates bananas, citrus fruits and coffee on the land that he owns. His brother is the one who teaches him agricultural techniques for improved production. He has been in agriculture for 4 years, and he likes to be on top of turning out a good fruit product; however, he finds it inconvenient to transfer his products from the farms because they are very heavy. His trade is very profitable because it allows him to live comfortably and to save for unforeseeable future events. In addition, he wants to build a house in the city to one day have a family. With time, he wants to purchase more land and to increase his coffee production. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he is always aware of the decisions made by his communal bank as a group because he is the secretary of the board of directors. With the two-thousand five-hundred "nuevos soles" (the local currency) that he is requesting, he will purchase 6 sacks of fertilizer, and in addition a "macheteadota" (a tool that removes the weeds from the land), which will make his work easier.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and machinery to clean his fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rosaluz

texts.es:
Rosaluz tiene 29 años, vive en su casa propia con su hijo mayor (de su primera pareja) y con su actual pareja Dionicio de 31, con quien tiene un hijo recién nacido. Está familia lucha para salir adelante siempre unidos.

A diario se dedican a la agricultura, a cultivar plátanos, frutas cítricas y palta desde hace 10 años, además para generar mayores ingresos económicos, en sus tiempos libres laboran de operarios, ganando 15 soles al día o de acuerdo a la cantidad que recolectan. 
De su oficio le gusta limpiar sus chacras, retirando constantemente las malezas para que sus frutos se desarrollen muy bien y les resulten rentables, pues con las utilidades que obtiene pueden brindarles sus hijos educación y bienestar.
Para el futuro, quiere instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa para que sus hijos la puedan administrar y generar sus propias ganancias.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal, porque las personas que integran su grupo son bastante unidas. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mil plantas de plátanos, también quiere hacer alcanzar el monto para pagar el jornal de los operarios que contratará.
texts.en:
Rosaluz is 29 years old. She lives in her own house with her oldest son (from her first partner) and with her current partner, Dionicio, who is 31 years old, with whom she has a newborn. This family works hard to get ahead together. They work every day in agriculture. They have been growing plantains, citrus fruits, and avocados for 10 years. Also, to generate extra income, in their free time they work as laborers, earning 15.00 PEN each day, or based on the amount they pick. The part she likes about her work is weeding the fields, constantly pulling back the weeds so that the crops will grow well and be profitable. With the profits they make they can provide for their children’s education and wellbeing. In the future, she would like to have a small grocery store in her house so that her children can run it an make their own income. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to be part of the communal bank because the members of the group are very close. With the money she is requesting, she will buy one thousand plantain starts. She also wants to use some of the amount to pay for the laborers that she will hire [to plant the starts].

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plantain starts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more baby items and accessories to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.es: William tiene 20 años, vive en casa de sus padres en compañía de sus hermanos. Hace más de 1 año se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de profesor a domicilio, él es docente de química y matemática. De esa manera imparte sus conocimientos a los alumnos que necesitan de algún refuerzo sobre estas materias. Su tarifa es por hora, por lo que una vez terminada la lección, recibe su honorario. La habilidad y el conocimiento que posee, lo ubican como un buen profesor y poco ha poco ha aumentado la cantidad de alumnos que debe enseñar. Es por ello que tiene la esperanza de tener su propio centro educativo. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, además esta contento por pertenecer a su grupo comunal, en donde lo consideran como una persona responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará libros actualizados que le servirán para seguir dictando sus clases.
texts.en:
William is 20 years old. He lives in his parent’s house with his siblings. For the past year, he has been working as a tutor. He teaches chemistry and math; he imparts his knowledge to students who need some assistance in these subjects. His fee is by the hour and once the lesson is over, he receives his pay. His ability and the knowledge he possesses have positioned him as a good teacher and little by little he has increased the number of students he tutors. Because of this, he hopes to open his own educational center. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and he is happy to belong to a communal bank, where he is considered a responsible person. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy current books that will help him to continue teaching his classes.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy books so that he can teach up-to-date classes

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
Misael de 23 años de edad es soltero, habita en casa de su mamá la Sra. Faustina R. junto a sus 5 hermanos, los cuales trabajan y ayudan con los gastos de la casa.  Trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 1 año como ayudante de albañil.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir un sumidero para los servicios higienicos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus hermanos para esta gestion, pues todos desean brindarle a su mamá mayor comodidad, y piensan que ahora es el tiempo de corresponder a todos los cuidados que ella les dio cuando eran pequeños.  

El mayor deseo es tener una casa bonita, con las condiciones basicas, y que su mamá tenga salud.
texts.en:
Misael is 23 years old and is single. He lives with his mother, Faustina R., along with his 5 siblings, all of whom who work and help with the household expenses. He has worked for one year the mayor’s office in the town of Juigalpa, as a mason’s assistant. He is requesting his first loan, with the goal of building a drain for the bathroom. He has the support of his siblings in this effort because they all want to make their mother more comfortable. They think now is the time to pay her back for all of the care she gave them when they were little. His greatest dream is to have a nice house with the basic conditions, and that his mother will be healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a drain

loans.name: Estrellas De Belen Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Panamericana, se reúnen la Asociación Comunal ESTRELLAS DE BELEN. Se agruparon hace 4 años aproximadamente, por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita mejorar sus negocios.

Una de las integrantes es Simona L. de 47 años desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a vender pan, negocio que le ha permitido cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de su familia, ahora necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen varias actividades económicas como la venta de ropa, jugos, servicio de transporte, venta de habas, comida cartones y tienda de barrio. 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y fortalecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Communal Association "Estrellas de Belen" (Stars of Bethlehem) meets at the Panamericana central office. The members formed this group approximately 4 years ago because they needed capital to improve their businesses. Simona L., 47 years old, is one of the members. For more than 10 years, she has sold bread. Her business has allowed her to cover the costs of her and her family's basic necessities. Now, she needs a loan to acquire merchandise. The other members of the group are involved in various economic activities such as selling clothes, juices, broad beans, food, and cardboard; offering transportation services, and operating a neighborhood shop. All of the members need the loan in order to invest and strengthen their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jose Baciliso

texts.es:
Jose de 43 años de edad es soltero, vive en union libre con la Sra. Maria Lilliam Lopez con quien procreo 2 hijos: Yudeisi de 5 añitos estudiando el preescolar y Franklin de 3 añitos, que aun no estudia.  Jose Baciliso trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 2 añoa como policia municipal.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto para contar con mayor comodidad y si el dinero lo permite comprar los protectores de hierro (verjas) para las ventanas y asi contar con mayor seguridad en su casa.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita, con las condiciones basicas, para que su familia se sienta comoda.
texts.en:
Jose 43-year-old, single. He lives with Ms. Maria Lopez Lilliam who bore two sons. Yudeis is 5 years old and in preschool and Franklin is 3 years old and is not yet in school. Jose Baciliso works for the city of Juigalpa as a municipal police officer since 2 years ago. He is requesting his third loan in order to improve their home by building another room so they are more comfortable. If the loan is sufficient, they will also buy buy protective iron (gates) for the windows so they will feel safer in their home. His greatest desire you have is to have a nice house, with the basic necessities to make his family feel comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an extension and buy gates

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efrain de 29 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Gissell Jaime con quien tiene una niña de nombre Yunieska de 6 añitos estudiando el 1er grado de primaria. Su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Efrain trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 3 años como policia municipal.  

Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y poniendole perlines para que dure mas, y si el dinero lo permita poner el piso a su casa para que su niña tenga mejor comodidad en su casa.  

El mayor deseo que tiene es poder tener una casa bonita, con las condiciones basicas, para que su familia se sienta comoda y que su hija crezca en un ambiente agradable.
texts.en:
Efrain, 29, is married to Gissell Jaime; they have a 6-year-old daughter, Yunieska, who is in first grade. His wife is a domestic employee and she helps him meet household expenses. Efrain has been a police officer for the city of Juigalpa for three years. He is asking for his 3rd loan to make some home improvements; he needs to replace the roof which is in poor condition adding metal edging so that it will last longer. If funds are sufficient, he will also install flooring in his house so that his daughter will have more comfort at home His greatest wish is to have a pretty home with basic condition so that his family will feel comfortable and his daughter will grow up in pleasant surroundings

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof and install flooring.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 53 años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender comestibles en su domicilio. Ya son 4 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Su actividad complementaria es vender ropa. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar útiles escolares por campaña escolar. 

Juana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana, 53 years old, belongs to the Valle Sagrado community bank part of the Arariwa Association. Currently, she lives in the city of Cala. Her principal job is selling groceries out of her house. She has had this business for four years, and it is going very well. She also works selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to buy school supplies for the school year. Juana is grateful for this opportunity, and she promises to make her loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Kambeng Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KAMBENG composé de 13 membres est un des 09 groupes de solidarité qui constituent le Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE situé dans la région de Ziguinchor. Il est créé en octobre 2002 lors de l'inauguration dudit Banc Villageois. Elles ont une moyenne d'âge de 40 et son mère d'au moins 4 enfants. Elle s'habitent toues le même village de TEREMBASSE.

le leader du groupe, Awa M. est âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres qui sont ses neveux. C'est un membre très dynamique et engagé dans l'organisation du Banc Villageois. Elle fait du maraîchage et se charge de la vente de ses produits dans la capitale régionale, Ziguinchor. Et comme activité secondaire elle développe un petit commerce de poissons frais dans les marchés hebdomadaires.
Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par l'achat des fournitures scolaires des enfants, leur nourriture et leur habillement.

Leur activité principale est la vente de poissons frais et des crevettes. Et comme activité secondaire elles développent un petit commerce d'huile de palme et de balais faits à partir des feuilles de palmiers. Leur lieu d'approvisionnement est leur village et elles écoulent en général leurs produits dans les marchés hebdomadaires de leur localité.  

Et pour la pérennité de leurs activités elle ont voulu augmenter leur capacité d'autofinancement en acceptant, pour la plus part d'entre elles, d'intégrer le Banc Villageois en octobre 2002. Et depuis, leur performance ne cesse d'augmenter.

Ce nouveau prêt leur permettra de mieux développer leurs différentes activité afin de se procurer des bénéfices pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The group KAMBENG, composed of thirteen members, is one of nine solidarity groups of the Banc Villageois de TEREMBASSE, located in the Ziguinchor region.  It was establish in October 2002 during the inauguration of the aforementioned Banc Villageois.  The members average 40 years of age and four children and all live in the same village of TEREMBASSE. The group leader, Awa M., is 33 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She is the guardian of three others, who are her nephews.  A very energetic member and devoted to the Banc Villageois organization, she has a market garden business. And she takes on the responsibility to sell her produce in the regional capital, Ziguinchor.  Secondarily, she is developing a small business selling fresh fish at the weekly markets.   Her goal is to take part in improving her family's living conditions by buying school supplies for the children, their food, and their clothing.  The group members' main work involves selling fresh fish and shrimp.  On the side, they are developing a small business selling palm oil and brooms made from palm fronds.  Their supply location is their village, and in general, they sell their goods at the weekly markets in their town. For the sustainability of their businesses, the group members wanted to increase their ability to self-finance.  To do so, most of them were willing to join the Banc Villageois in October 2002.  Since then, their performance has been increasing non-stop. This new loan will enable them to develop further their different businesses in order to obtain the profits for responding to family needs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering their ability to self-finance the group for developing their businesses further

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es:
Santosa tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos y su esposo Antonio de 40 años; esta familia trabaja diario para salir adelante.

Su motivación diaria son sus hijos, por eso junto su esposo llevan 10 años cultivando frutas cítricas, plátano, maíz y café en sus terrenos propios. De la agricultura lo que más le gusta es ver cómo sus frutos se desarrollan y luego los comercializa a precios considerables en el mercado de su ciudad. 
Santosa menciona: “llevar los productos es difícil, pero resulta rentable, pues a mis hijos no les falta nada, nosotros como padres estamos satisfechos, porque no sufren las necesidades que nosotros sufrimos”.
Para el futuro quiere incrementar su producción de plátanos e iniciarse en la crianza de gallinas.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está contenta de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque se siente capaz de lograr su progreso, por eso cuida mucho su historial crediticio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará doscientas plantas de plátano y tres sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Santosa is 35 years old. She lives with his four children and Antonio, her husband of 40 years. Her family works hard every day to improve their lives. Her daily motivation are her children, and for their sake she and her husband have been working for 10 years growing citrus fruits, corn, and coffee on their land. What she likes most about his job is seeing the plants grow and then sell them at a the market in his city. Santosa says, "Transporting our products is difficult, but it is profitable. Our children don't lack anything, so as parents we are satisfied because they lack the necessities like we did." In the future she wants to produce more plantains and start to raise chickens. This is her third loan with MFP, and he is happy to be working with the community bank because she feels capable of achieving progress with these loans. She has been careful protecting his credit history. She will use the loan money to buy 200 plantain plants and three bags of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantain plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa y tiene 59 años.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el mercado modelo de Calca. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para la educación de sus hijos.

Andrea se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.   (En la fotografía la socia esta acompañada de su hija Marivel).
texts.en:
Andrea belongs to the commercial bank "Valle Sagrado" (Sacred Valley), which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 59 years old, and currently lives in the city of Calca. Her main economic activity is selling food in the Mercado Modelo in Calca. She has had this business now for 10 years, and it is going very well. She needs a loan to pay for the education of her children. Andrea is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule. (In the photograph she is accompanied by her daughter, Marivel.)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the education of her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more wood (planks) to sell.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Marivel pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 40 años y tiene dos hijos.  Actualmente, vive en la ciudad de Calca. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender comida en el mercado modelo de Calca. Ya son 20  años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de chancho y cordero.

Marivel se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Marivel belongs to the commercial bank "Valle Sagrado" (Sacred Valley), which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 40 years old, and has 2 children. She currently lives in the city of Calca. Her main economic activity is selling food in the Mercado Modelo in Calca. She has had this business for 20 years, and it is going very well. She needs a loan to buy pork and lamb meat. Marivel is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means, and she pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pork and lamb meat

loans.name: Élisabeth Sabine

texts.fr: K. Élisabeth Sabine est née le 23 Septembre 1957 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Élisabeth Sabine est mariée à PADONOU Cyriaque, et est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Mais parmi ses enfants, un ne vit plus avec elle. Élisabeth Sabine vit avec ses trois enfants et son mari au quartier Finagnon à Cotonou. Il y a près de 28 ans que Élisabeth Sabine s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Élisabeth Sabine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Depuis douze ans environs, Élisabeth Sabine vend à son domicile, du charbon de bois, qu'elle achète en gros auprès des camionneurs. La clientèle de Élisabeth Sabine s'accroit de plus en plus. C'est donc pour rehausser son activité et satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients que Élisabeth Sabine sollicite pour la première fois de prêt à ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Sabine Elizabeth was born September 23, 1957 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to Padonou Cyriac and is the mother of four children, who are all in school.  But one of her children no longer lives with her.  Sabine Elizabeth lives with her three children and husband in the Finagnon district of Cotonou. She settled in this district 28 years ago.  The couple jointly ensure that the various family expenses are covered.  Elizabeth Sabine did not attend school very much.  For about twelve years, she has been selling charcoal out of her house, which she purchases in bulk from truckers.  Her customer base is growing and growing.  And so, to enhance her business and to satisfy the strong customer demand, she is requesting a loan from Alidé for the first time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 39 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 5 años que posee una tienda, en donde vende productos básicos de consumo humano, además vende también animales, previamente cebados durante 3 meses. De esta manera abastece a sus vecinos y clientes con productos de primera necesidad y los fines de semana se va a la feria ganadera para vender sus animales, en ocasiones le ayudan sus hijos, ya que el transportar estos animales le resulta muy pesado. Ella se encuentra muy satisfecha con la actividad que realiza, puesto que las ganancias que obtiene lo derivarán para comprar mercadería para su tienda. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Además considera que este aporte será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. El crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería en conservas y productos enlatados, asimismo desea comprar ovejas para cebarlos y venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 39 years old, and lives in her own house with her 3 children. For more than 5 years she has had a store where she sells basic necessities. In addition, she also sells animals that were previously fattened over a 3-month period. In this way, she meets the needs of her neighbors and customers for basic necessities, and on the weekends she goes to the livestock market to sell her animals. Occasionally her children help her, since transporting the animals is very difficult. She is very satisfied with the work that she does; she uses the earnings she gets to purchase more merchandise for her store. This is her 9th loan with MFP; therefore she will be very responsible with her payments. In addition, she feels that this support will help her to make progress with her business. The loan she requests will be used to buy canned goods. In addition, she wants to buy sheep to fatten and later sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock her store with a variety of canned goods, and also to buy a sheep.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene 65 años, tiene cuatro hijos. Su principal actividad económica es ser chofer de un bus inter provincial.  Ya son 13 años que se dedica al servicio y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es comprar y vender vehículos usados. 

Antonio es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Antonio requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para refaccionar los carros usados.   

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Antonio, 65, is a member of the “VALLE SAGRADO” (Sacred Valley) communal bank. He has four children and his main commercial activity consists in being an inter-provincial bus driver. He has been in this line of work for 13 years and does quite well. In addition, he is a used car merchant. Antonio is a responsible, enterprising person who is always looking for opportunities to get ahead in life and to help his family through his own efforts. He needs funds to buy supplies with which to refurbish the used cars. He is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. .

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy parts for used cars.

loans.name: La Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimieto conformado por ocho integrantes los cuales en su gran mayoria son oriundos de las ciudades de Santa Cruz, Oruro y chuquisaca de los 8 clientes 6 tienen negocio propio en la localidad de la  guardia en distintos lugares del mercado de el torno,  todos los socios viven en la zona de la Guardia, cuentan con sus negocios hace vaR. años.

La Sra. MARY es la presidenta del banco se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene su puesto de venta en el mercado de el Torno se dedica  a esta actividad hace vaR. años, empezo vendiendo poca mercaderia pero con los prestamos de la institucion, crecio y ahora cuenta con un buen capital de trabajo, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia de temporada ropa abrigada para la epoca de invierno.

De los 8 integrantes cuentan con casa propia 2,  sus sueños de los socios del  banco de emprendimientos es  llegar a tene sus casitas, empresas y vehiculos todos los socios son Padres de familia y Madre de familias, trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus familias y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
This entrepreneurial bank is formed by eight members, most of whom are from the cities of Santa Cruz, Oruro and Chuquisaca. Of the eight members, six have their own business in Guardia, in different areas of the Torno market. All of the members live in the Guardia area, and have had their businesses for several years. Mary is the president of the group and sells clothing from a stall in the Torno market. She has done this activity for several years. She began selling just a little bit of merchandise, but with loans from the institution the business grew, and now she has good working capital. With this loan, she will buy seasonal merchandise, like warm clothing for the winter. Of the eight members, two have their own houses. The bank members dream of having their own homes, companies and vehicles. All of them are heads of household, and they work hard to get their families ahead and to be able to improve the quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene 70  años, tiene cuatro hijos. Su principal actividad económica es vender locería.  

Toribio es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Toribio requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de locería como por ejemplo platos,  tazas, ollas y muchas cosas.   

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Toribio, 70, is a member of the “VALLE SAGRADO” (Sacred Valley) communal bank. He has four children and his main commercial activity consists in dinnerware sales. Toribio is a responsible, enterprising person who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and help his family through his own efforts. Toribio needs funds to buy dinnerware items like: dishes, cups, pots, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted dinnerwear, pots and pans, cups, etc.

loans.name: Djola Sylvie

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, D.  Djola Sylvie est mariée à ZINSOU Aubin, un mécanicien auto. Djola Sylvie est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a près de quinze ans que Djola Sylvie s'est installée au quartier Tokplégbé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Djola Sylvie assure avec l'aide de son mari, les différentes charges de la famille. Djola Sylvie n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. C'est depuis neuf ans que Djola Sylvie mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois à son domicile. Parallèlement, Djola Sylvie vend également des produits vivriers. Djola Sylvie achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Face à la forte demande de sa clientèle, Djola Sylvie n'arrive plus à tous les satisfaire. Pour mieux répondre à la demande des clients et enregistrer plus de revenus, Djola Sylvie sollicite pour la première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. D. Djole Sylvie is married to Mr. ZINSOU Aubin, an auto mechanic. She is the mother of three children, who are all in school.  Fifteen years ago, she settled in the Tokplégbé district in Cotonou, where she lives with her children and her husband.  Along with her husband, she ensure that the various family expenses are covered.  Djole Sylvie never attended school.  For nine years, she has had a business selling charcoal out of her home.  At the same time, she also sells staple foods.  She purchases her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin.  Faced with the strong demand from her customers, she is no longer able to satisfy all of them.  To respond better to the demand and to register more revenues, Sylvie Djole is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying charcoal

loans.name: Las Canelas Group

texts.es:
Florentina M. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Las Canelas que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, tiene 28 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, indica que ingresó a Pro Mujer a invitación de sus amigas.
 
Ella se dedica a  tejer mantas hace más de 10 años y con el préstamo tiene planificado comprar materia prima como la lana.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: venta de quinua, trenzado de mantas y venta de aguayos (tela colorida que se utiliza para cargar bebes).
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Florentina M., 28, is a member of the Las Canelas communal bank which, in turn, is a member of the Panamericana focal center. She is from the city of El Alto and she tells us that her girlfriends invited her to join Pro Mujer. She has been a blanket weaver for over 10 years and she plans to use the requested funds to buy raw materials like wool. The other members of this communal bank are involved in a variety of commercial activities, such as: quinoa sales, blanket braiding, sale of “aguayos” (colorful cloths used to carry babies). They all need funds to acquire merchandise, ingredients or raw materials according to each type of business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material (wool).

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly tiene 25 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 5 años se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad en su bodega, que se encuentra ubicada en un pequeño espacio dentro de su domicilio. Desde entonces atiende con mucha dedicación a sus clientes, ya que de ellos depende para que su negocio progrese, además sus fieles compradores se encuentran muy satisfechos con la compra que realizan. Es así que este negocio le permite tener las rentas necesarias para sostener a su familia, por lo que esta  pensando adquirir mayor cantidad de productos, con el fin de tener una tienda surtida con variados productos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería en productos básicos, como: arroz, azúcar, aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
Nelly, 25, is a single mother of two children; she lives in her parents’ house. For over five years she has sold basic grocery items from a store located in a small space in her home. Since then she has tended to her customers with much dedication because she depends on them for her success; besides her regular customers are very satisfied with the purchases they make. This is how her store makes it possible for her to earn profits sufficient to support her family. She is therefore thinking about acquiring a larger quantity of products in order to have a store stocked with a better selection of assorted products This is her 4th loan with MFP so she will be very responsible with her payments. Besides she considers this capital influx to be very useful for her business’ progress. She will use the requested funds to buy basic stock items, such as: rice, sugar and cooking oil among others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic stock items like: sugar, rice, cooking oil.

loans.name: Claudia Ramona

texts.es: La señora Claudia Ramona es una mujer muy responsable y luchadora, este no es el primer financiamiento que ella tiene con Fundación León 2000. Su actividad económica es la venta de pollo, queso y refrescos, este negocio recientemente le ha generado muy buenos ingresos para su familia, pues le gusta mucho atender su negocio, pues las ganancias que obtiene son muy satisfactorias para los gastos de su familia. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mantener sus negocios que son lo más importante para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Claudia Ramona is a responsible and ambitious woman. This is not the first loan that she has taken from the Fundación León 2000. Her main economic activity is selling chicken, cheese and soft drinks. Recently, this business has generated very good earnings for her family. She likes attending to her business very much, and the earnings she obtains are very satisfactory for meeting the expenses of the household. She requests this loan for working capital that will be used to buy raw materials. She wishes to maintain her businesses, which are so important for supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, B. Suzanne est mariée à KEGNIDE Boniface, un revendeur. Suzanne est mère de deux enfants, dont un est scolarisé. Suzanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Lokokoukoumè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Il y a environs huit ans que Suzanne s'est installée dans ce quartier. Suzanne n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour assurer ses multiples besoins et subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants, Suzanne vend depuis cinq ans déjà, des mèches et divers produits de beauté dans sa boutique à Lokokoukoumè. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Suzanne achète ses produits. Suzanne a obtenu antérieurement, deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Suzanne désire renforcer son activité et élever le niveau de son activité ; ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et aussi d'assurer un bon train de vie à ses enfants. Pour ce faire, Suzanne sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Ms. B. Suzanne is married to Mr. KEGNIDE Boniface, a retailer.  She is the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. Suzanne lives together with her children and husband in the Lokokoukoumè district in the town of Seme-Podji. She settled in this district about eight years ago. Suzanne never attended school. To meet multiple needs of hers and to provide for her children, she has been selling hair extensions and various beauty products for five years now in her shop in Lokokoukoumè.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she purchases her supplies. Suzanne previous obtained two ALIDé loans, both of which she repaid.  She would like to bolster her business and to raise her level of activity.  This will enable her to satisfy her customers further and also to ensure good living conditions for her children.  To do so, Suzanne is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and hair care product

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco V.  vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea, es casado y  tiene 5 hijos: 4 mujeres y un varon, todos estudian.  Francisco trabaja como Guarda de seguridad  desde hace 19 años,  el se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesto y trabajador  desde  niño a aprendido a trabajar y a valorar lo que mas ama su familia, su esposa labora como operaria de una planta procesadora de tuberculos, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos.  

Está solicitando financiamiento de su 6to credito, con el cual pretende construir  una habitaciòn y asi brindarles a sus hijos mayor privacidad y seguridad, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos econòmicos.  Expresa que se siente muy agradecido con AFODENIC ya que poco a poco han mejorado su nivel de vida, pues los creditos anteriores los ha invertido en la mejora de su casa.  

Su sueños es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Francisco V. lives in zone #7 of Nueva Guinea, is married and the father of 5 children: 4 girls and a boy, who are all studying. Francisco has worked as a security guard for the past 19 years, and is a responsible, honest and hard worker who as a child learned to value work and family above all. Francisco shares responsibility for household expenditures with his wife, who works in a plant processing root vegetables. Mr. Velazques seeks his 6th microcredit loan in order to constuct an additional room on his house in order to provide for his children with increased space, privacy and security in their modest home. He is very grateful to AFODENIC for its microlending services, which have greatly benefited his family and household. Francisco hopes for continued work stability, a dignified home and success for his children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room addition for house

loans.name: Maria Concepción

texts.es:
La señora María P. O. es una microempresaria habitante de un pequeño pueblo ubicado en la costa norte de Colombia llamado Arjona, muy cerca de la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias; en este municipio las principales actividades son la agricultura, la ganadería, la elaboración de productos alimenticios como bollos, buñuelos de maíz y queso y el comercio especialmente el de prendas de vestir, calzados y enseres para el hogar; en medio de sus festividades, cabalgatas, reinados populares y festivales de acordeones,  funciona el negocio “Variedades Mary”, donde María P., mujer de 44 años, comercializa sabanas, accesorios de vestir collares, pulseras, aretes, relojes, perfumes, cosméticos, planchas, ollas, floreros y ofrece a la comunidad el servicio de llamadas telefónicas; ella es una mujer emprendedora que inició su pequeño negocio hace 5 años y gradualmente ha venido creciendo, impulsada por el anhelo de  ganar mas dinero para terminar de construir su casa, para vivir con su cónyuge y tres hijos que estudian, uno  en el nivel de bachillerato y los otros dos en la universidad. 

En la actualidad solicita que se le apoye con un crédito por valor de $ 2.000.000, que le permita invertir en la compra de  mercancías como camisas, suéteres, chancletas, perfumes, vajillas, ollas, sabanas, collares, aretes, pulseras y una nueva vitrina; con ello atendería pedidos con mayor oportunidad en su entrega a los clientes,   ganaría un nuevo mercado y aumentaría sus ingresos, para poder seguir invirtiéndole poco a poco a su vivienda hasta terminarla, ahorrándose el pago de arriendo y mejorando el aspecto físico de su negocio, pues dedicaría un espacio más adecuado para organizarlo. Para Maria, uno de sus desafíos mas importantes, además de terminar su vivienda, es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales, con su  esfuerzo en la microempresa y con el apoyo de su cónyuge que se desempeña como conductor.
texts.en:
María P. O. is a small businesswoman who lives in a small town located on the northern coast of Colombia named Arjona, which is very close to the city of Cartagena de Indias. In this town the main activities are agriculture, livestock production, the production of food products such as buns and corn and cheese fritters, and trade: especially the sale of garments, shoes and home furnishings. Maria P., 44, has a business called Variedades Mary. She sells bed sheets, accessories, necklaces, bracelets, earrings, watches, perfumes, cosmetics, irons, pots, vases, and offers the community telephone call services. She does this in the midst of the town's festivities, parades on horseback, pageants, and accordion festivals. She is an enterprising woman who started her small business 5 years ago. It has gradually grown, driven by her desire to earn more money in order to finish building her house so that she can live there with her husband and her 3 children who are in school: one at the secondary level and the other two at the university. She is currently seeking the support of a loan in the amount of 2 million Colombian pesos, which will allow her to invest in the purchase of merchandise such as shirts, sweaters, sandals, perfumes, dishes, pots, bed sheets, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and a new glass showcase. This way she can deliver her orders more promptly and gain new customers and increase her income. She wants to continue to invest little by little until she can finish her house, so she can save the money paid on rent, and have a dedicated space for her business that would improve its physical aspect and provide the space needed for its organization. For Maria, one of her most important challenges in addition to finishing her house is to help her children become professionals, a goal that she will achieve with her effort in her small business, and with the support of her husband, who works as a driver.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as shirts, sweaters, sandals, perfumes, plates, pots, necklaces, earrings, bracelets, and a new glass display case

loans.name: Cooperativa Group

texts.es:
Manuela Q. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Cooperativa que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, indica que ingresó a Pro Mujer a invitación de una vecina.
 
Ella atiende una tienda de barrio, donde tiene productos como pan, leche, azúcar, dulces, galletas, conservas, arroz, fideo y otros. Florentina necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y tener una tienda surtida. 
Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como: tejido de mantas,  venta de fruta, artesanía, venta de pilas, papa y fruta.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Manuela Q. is a member of both the Asociacion Comunal Cooperative and the Centro Focal Panamericana. She is a resident of the city of El Alto. She says that she joined Pro Mujer after being invited by a neighbor. She operates a neighborhood store where she sells products such as bread, milk, sugar, candy, cookies, jams, rice, pasta and so on. She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store. Other members of this association operate a range of businesses: weaving blankets, selling fruit, making and selling traditional craft products, etc. All of the members need funds to buy merchandise, supplies and basic materials, each according to the kind of business they own.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijas mujeres , la cuales estudian y ayudan a sus padres con los quehaceres del hogar, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en la finca que ellos poseen y asume  los gastos del hogar; Juana trabaja como docente desde hace 23 años  en el Municipio de Nueva Guinea en la colonia Nuevo Leòn, se caracteriza por ser  muy sencilla, honesta, trabajadora y muy querida por sus compañeros de trabajo.  

Está solicitando su 6to crèdito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda, cambiando el zinc a su casa ya que se encuentra en mal estado, y como se acerca el invierno quiere cambiarlo con urgencia para evitar se le deterioren sus cosas.  Expresa sentirse agradecida con la Institución de AFODENIC ya que con los créditos anteriores ha comprado electrodomésticos y a mejorado poco a poco la vivienda donde ella vive junto a su familia.  

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijas estudien y puedan obtener un trabajo que les permita tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, 39, is married and has two daughters who go to school and help their parents with household chores. Her husband farms their own lands and takes care of household expenses. Juana has been a teacher for 23 years in the Nuevo León neighborhood of the city of Nueva Guinea; she is known for being very unassuming, honest, hard-working and highly thought of by her coworkers. She is asking for her 6th loan to invest in home improvements. She wants to replace the zinc metal roof which is in poor condition; it’s urgent she does so because winter is approaching and she doesn’t want her belongings to be damaged. She expresses her gratitude towards AFODENIC because previous loans have made it possible for her to buy home appliances and to gradually improve her home where she lives together with her family. Her greatest wish is that her daughters can study so that they can get a job that will permit them better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof.

loans.name: Abukakorikoula Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe ABUKAKORIKOULA est composé de 08 membres et fait partie des 09 groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois. Elles ont 8ans d'existence dans Le Banc Villageois et la plus part des membres a reçu au moins 17 fois de crédit et n'ont jamais eu de problème de remboursement. 

Leur activité principale est l'agriculture mais parallèlement elle font de la transformation et vente de savon en poudre. Pendant l'hivernage elles font cultiver de l'arachide et en contre saison elle font de la patate douce et des tomates. Elles vendent les récoltes dans les différents marchés hebdomadaires de leur localité.

Quant à la femme leader du groupe, elle est âgée de 33 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle à achète des arachides cultivées par les paysans de son village pour aller revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Elle fait également du maraîchage en produisant de la patate douce et des tomates. Et comme ses autres camarades, elle fait de la transformation et vente de savon en poudre. 

Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter des semences, des intrants agricoles et du produit de base pour la transformation de savon.

Se sont des femmes qui contribuent beaucoup aux charges familiales d'autant plus que la plus part des maris ne sont pas salariés.
texts.en:
The group ABUKAKORIKOULA is composed of eight members that form one of nine groups, which make up the Banc Villageois.  The members have been together for eight years in Banc Villageois. Most of the members have received a loan at least seventeen times and have never had any repayment problems.   Their main business involves agriculture. But at the same time, they process soap into powder and sell it.  In the winter, they grown peanuts. In the off-season, it is sweet potatoes and tomatoes.  They sell the harvests at the different weekly markets in their town. As for the woman leader of the group, she is 33 years old, married, and the mother of six children to support.  She buys peanuts grown by the peasants of her village to sell at the weekly markets.  She also has a market garden business producing sweet potatoes and tomatoes.  And, just like her friends, she processes soap into powder and sells it.  The current loan will be used to buy seeds, agricultural supplies, and basic items for processing soap.  The women are the ones who contribute a lot to covering family expenses, more so than the husbands, most of whom do not have salaries. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and supplies for developing their farm work

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 12 años se dedica a vender artículos de limpieza para el hogar, actividad que también realizan sus hijos de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales de su ciudad, una manera de apoyarla en el trabajo. Es así que ínter diario salen a vender estos productos, y más cuando son fechas festivas, que es cuando tiene mayor demanda. Ella disfruta mucho su trabajo, ya que las ganancias que recibe son la recompensa al arduo trabajo que tuvo día tras día, soportando los días soleados o de lluvia. Es por ello que desea tener un puesto de venta e incrementar su capital de trabajo. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto será muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de mercadería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Susy, 35, lives with her 2 children in the house of her parents. For more than 12 years, she has made a living selling home cleaning products, work that her children also now do. They work as street vendors in various markets around their city. Susy goes out every day to sell these products and she works even harder on holidays because that is when demand is greatest. She likes her work very much and the money she makes is the reward for the difficult job that she has to do day after day, rain or shine. It's for this business that she would like to have a kiosk and additional working capital. This is her third MFP loan and she has shown that she will be responsible about repaying it. This support will be very helpful to the progress of her business. She will use the loan to buy merchandise so that she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis tiene 35 años, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Pues siempre le ha gustado este negocio ya que desde hace mucho tiempo que busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a su familia. La competencia para Jorge es muy grande, pero no ofrecen el cariño y entusiasmo que él tiene también los clientes que tienen son algo estable. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de llantas y repuestos. Su deseo es tener más camiones para generar trabajo y asi mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 35 years old and for more than 12 years has made a living in transportation. He has always liked the business because for a long time he looked for a way to increase his income to provide for his family. Jorge's level of competition is very high, but they don't offer the care and enthusiasm like he does, and his clients are pretty stable as well. He is requesting the loan to purchase tires and parts for his truck. His wish is to have more trucks to generate more work and income and thus improve his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tires and spare parts

loans.name: Los Unicos Group

texts.es:
El Banco de Emprendimiento LOS UNICOS esta esta conformado 8 integrantes se encuentran en su primer ciclo, son nuevos todos viven en la misma zona en el barrio El Carmen, cuentan con negocio propio hace  dos años en el km 9 camino a Santa C..

La Sra. LIZETH es la presidenta dle banco fue elegida por su responsabilidad compañerismo y solidaridad que demostro en el trato a las socias, la Sra. Lizeth se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos por catalogo de una prestigios empresa a nivel Mundial, con el dinero del credito comprara cosmeticos que se  encuentran en promocion, las revistas sacan productos en promocion que se encuentran mas baratos que el precio original y siguiente publicacion el producto que estaba mas barato, en la nueva publicacion esta mas caro, y asi ella obtiene una ganancia extra.
 

Las socias de este banco de emprendimiento en su gran mayoria son Padres de Familia y son personas muy luchadoras ellos tienen el sueño de que sus negocios engrandesca y ser muy exitosos, y asi poder mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia, ellos se encuentran agradecidos con la institucion por brindarles la confianza en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
The venture bank group Los Unicos is comprised of eight members in their first cycle. They all live in the same neighborhood in El Carmen, nine kilometers from Santa C.. They have had their own business for two years. Lizeth is the president of the bank group. She was chosen for her responsibility, camaraderie, and solidarity, which she has demonstrated in her treatment of the other members. Lizeth sells catalog cosmetics from a prestigious worldwide company. With this loan, she will buy cosmetics on sale. The magazines promote products much cheaper than their original prices, and in subsequent publications the cheaper products become much more expensive, and this is how she makes an extra profit. The majority of the members of this venture bank group are heads of family and they are fighters. They dream that their businesses will expand and be very successful, and then they will be able to improve the quality of life for all their families. They are grateful to the institution for having the confidence in them to loan them credit.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Alamouta Group

texts.en:
The group "Alamouta" comprises seven women from the region of Ziguinchor, Senegal. The group is a solidarity group and part of the "Banc Villageois" TEREMBASSE founded in 2002. The seven members are mainly seafood traders. Since their group has been formed, the members have always paid back their loans to Kiva's local fieldpartner, Caurie Microfinance, without any problem. ("Alamouta" is a common prayer in the region.)

Diénéba B. is the leader of the group. She is 26 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is also rsponsible for another child in her polygamous family. Diénéba B. has two occupations: for 5 years she has been a market gardener, but more recently she has also started turning peanuts into peanut oil. With her loan, she wants to buy more peanuts as well as to invest in her gardening. The revenue from her activities allows her to support her family, primarily by improving alimentation and paying for her children's school expenses and clothes.

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Cécile H.

texts.fr: Née en 1977, S. Cécile H. vit depuis une quinzaine d'année au quartier Dandji à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Cécile est mariée à DOSSOU Jean, un cuisinier, et est mère de deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Cécile vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Cécile n'a jamais été à l'école, mais a appris la coiffure. En plus de cette activité qu'elle exerce, Cécile vend également des mèches, des produits de coiffure et des tissus dans son atelier de coiffure situé au quartier Sodjéatinmey à Cotonou. Cécile achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cécile est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu quatre crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Cécile sollicite un cinquième prêt en vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux faire face aux différentes demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1977, S. Cecile H. has lived for fifteen years in the Dandji district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to DOSSOU John, a cook, and is the mother of two children, who are both in school.  She lives with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensure that family expenses are covered. Cecilia never attended school, but she learned how to style hair.  In addition to this work she has, Cecilia also sells hair extensions, hairdressing products, and fabrics in her hair salon located in the Sodjéatinmey district in Cotonou.  Cecilia is a former ALIDé client having already obtained four loans, which have all been repaid. She is requesting a fifth loan to raise her business level and to cope better with the different demands of her customers. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying hair extensions and hairstyling products

loans.name: Early Fredy

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “COMUZONE”; Nuestro socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco, en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Early,  él tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, nuestro socio es policía de profesión y alterna esta su principal actividad con el préstamo de servicios de taxi, Nuestro socio compró un vehículo y en sus ratos libres trabaja con su auto prestando el servicio de taxi, el socio aún no tiene hijos y solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para su auto.
 
Nuestro socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Early belongs to the “COMUZONE” Community Bank and lives in the city of Cusco, district of Huanchac, Peru. He is 29 years old and single. He works as a police officer and aside from this activity also drives a taxi. He purchased a vehicle and drives it in his free time offering his service. Early doesn't have any children and is requesting the loan to purchase parts for his taxi. He is grateful for the loan and values the support through these means and promises to fulfill his payments in the established period.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for his taxi

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.es: Jimmy tiene 22 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos. Hace más de 4 años, toca en una banda musical vernacular, por lo que cuenta con su propio instrumento. Generalmente los fines de semana es donde tiene mayor demanda sus servicios, ya que siempre hay celebraciones y eventos sociales que se dan en su localidad y alrededores. Este trabajo le permite estudiar en la universidad y solventar sus estudios de ingeniería, por lo que disfruta de su trabajo, puesto que desde muy joven siempre ha tocado varios instrumentos musicales como pasatiempo. Su mayor anhelo es convertirse en un profesional en su carrera y también en la música, por ser su fuente actual de ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete ser responsable en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de un instrumento musical.
texts.en:
Jimmy is 22 years old and lives with his parents and siblings. For the past four years he has played in a music group, so of course he has his own instrument. Generally the group's services are in high demand on weekends, since there are always celebrations and social events in the town and surrounding areas. This work allows him to attend a university and afford his engineering studies. Since he was very young he has enjoyed playing all kinds of instruments as a pastime. His biggest goal is to become a professional as an engineer as well as a musician and enjoy those sources of income. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he promises to be responsible with his payments. With the loan, he plans to purchase another musical instrument.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a musical instrument

loans.name: Koutediomboulou Group

texts.en:
The group "Koutediomboulou" is a solidarity group and part of the "Banc Villageois" TEREMBASSE, a village in the southern part of Senegal. The seven women in this group got together in 2002, when the "Banc Villageois" was founded. They all work in agriculture. In the eight years that they have been clients of Caurie Microfinance, one of Kiva's Fieldpartners in the region, they have always paid back their loans on time.

Motafé Touré is the leader of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother of three. She is also responsible for six nephews. Motafé Touré sells sugar, palm oil, bananas and much more. She is experienced in this activity and wants to use her loan to buy more of the products she sells. With the earnings from her business she is able to cover some of the costs of her large family such as health care and clothes for the children.

loans.use: increase her inventory

loans.name: Émeline Clarisse

texts.fr: A. Émeline Clarisse est née le 10 Août 1975 et vit depuis une dizaine d'année au quartier Yénawa à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Émeline Clarisse est mariée à BANKOLE Victor et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble à Yénawa. Émeline Clarisse vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges familiales. Émeline Clarisse n'a jamais fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Émeline Clarisse vend de la glace, des jus de bissap et de citron et d'autres boissons sucrées à son domicile. Émeline Clarisse s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Émeline Clarisse est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui avait déjà bénéficié de trois prêts, qu'elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Émeline Clarisse ambitionne rehausser le niveau de son activité et augmenter son stock de produits. C'est pour cette raison que Émeline Clarisse sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Émeline Clarisse A. was born on August 10, 1975. She has been living for about a dozen years in the Yénawa district in Cotonout, the economic capital of Benin. She is married to Victor Bankole and is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. The family lives together in Yénawa. Émeline Clarisse helps her husband support the family. She never went to school. To provide for the family, she sells ice, hibiscus and lemon juice and other soft drinks out of her home. She buys her stock in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. Émeline Clarisse is an old client of ALIDé, and had obtained three loans in the past, all of which she has duly repaid. In response to the growing customer demand, she would like to expand her business and enlarge her stock of products. This is why she is seeking a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing hibuscus flower, sugar, little plastic bags, lemons etc, for the preparation of soft drinks

loans.name: Osorio

texts.es:
Osorio tiene 23 Años, vive con sus padres y hermana en casa de ellos. Hace más de 3 años empezó a elaborar fustanes y blusas típicas de su región. Es así que trabaja todos días en su casa, durante medio tiempo, ya que el resto del día se lo dedica al estudio. El fin de semana sale a vender lo que ha producido durante toda la semana, por lo que siente satisfacción el ver sus ganancias. Este negocio le es rentable por lo que le facilita a continuar con sus ventas, es por que ello que espera tener otra maquina para producir en cantidad. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser responsable en sus pagos, además considera que el aporte que recibirá le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará tela e hilos a fin de tener más capital disponible para producir.
texts.en:
Osorio is 23 years old and lives with his parents and sister in their house. More than three years ago, he began producing skirts and traditional blouses of the region. He works every day from home until noon and then spends the rest of the day studying. On the weekends, he sells what he has produced throughout the week. Luis is very satisfied with the earnings he has seen. This business is profitable and provides an easy way for him to continue his sales. He hopes to obtain another machine so that he can produce in quantity. This is his first loan with MFP. Osorio promises to be responsible with his payments since he considers the loan to be useful in advancing his business. The proceeds from the loan he requested will be used to buy fabric and thread so that he will have more available production capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & thread for producing skirts and blouses

loans.name: Escarlatas 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Sonia, 59, is the coordinator of her group Las Escarlatas (The Scarlets), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Los Alcarrizos, a dusty industrial area, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their two adult children.

Sonia is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling natural medicines, purses and sweets. She will use the profits to pay for her medicines. She also intends to aid her daughter in achieving her dream of completing a master's in medicine. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy medicines, purses, and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. BENITA,  ella tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene 2 menores hijos, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de  animales menores, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos, y cuyes.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción” (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception). She lives in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

Benita is 42 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two dependent children. She divides her time between her housework and her small business that includes farming and raising small animals. Benita is requesting a loan to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

She appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & guinea pigs

loans.name: Libertad Group

texts.es:
Verónica M. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Libertad que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Panamericana, tiene 26 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, menciona que ingresó a Pro Mujer a invitación de una vecina.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, desde hace 3 años aproximadamente en la feria 16 de Julio, los jueves y domingos.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas de producción, servicio y comercio y necesitan el préstamo para adquirir mercadería, insumos o materia prima, según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Verónica M. is a member of the “Libertad” (Freedom) Communal Association, which is part of the Pan American Community Center. She is 26 years old and resides in the city of El Alto. It should be mentioned that she joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a neighbor. Verónica has been selling clothing for approximately three years at the July 16th fair every Thursday and Sunday.

The other members of this Association have business activities in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors. They need this loan to acquire merchandise, supplies, and raw materials according to their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Devora is the coordinator of her group Mujeres en Victoria 1,2 (Women of Victoria), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsuL., a lush, rugged isthmus with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and her child.

Devora is excited to be taking her tenth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business.
