Il y a une dizaine d’année que Sidonie s’est installée au quartier Fifadji à Cotonou, où elle vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges familiales. Sidonie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Sidonie vend du maïs. Sidonie prépare et vend également de la pâte de maïs de façon ambulante. Sidonie s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Sidonie exerce cette activité depuis trois ans environs, et a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts de ALIDé, prêts qui ont été bien remboursés. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre aux besoins variés de sa clientèle, Sidonie sollicite un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1984 in Cotonou, economic capital of Benin, K. Sidonie is married to AGBOKI Janvier, a carpenter. The couple has three children, some of whom are in school. About ten years ago Sidonie settled in the Fifadji neighborhood of Cotonou, where she lives with her children and husband. The couple pays the various family expenses jointly. Sidonie has never been to school. To meet her expenses, she sells corn. She also prepares and sells corn mash as a street vendor. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, international market of Benin. Sidonie has been in business for about three years, and has already received two loans through ALIDé, which she has fully repaid. In order to build up her business and better meet the various needs of her customers, Sidonie is seeking a third loan.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn

loans.name: Pablo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pablo es de edad de 51 años es  padre de familia de dos hijos, Desde hace varios años trabaja de albañil el cual adquirió experiencia desde joven, también ha trabajado en seguridad en las expresas privada. Hoy en día cuida una casa por la noche y así gana un poco mas de dinero ya que abecés los trabajos de construcción están escasos. El es de recursos económicos bajos y con las pocas ganancias hizo su casa de concreto pero aun faltan mejoras y lo que desea primeramente es embaldosar la sala para una mejor higiene, para esto comprara: arena, cemento para comenzar la obra. 
Sus planes a futuro es poder hacer las divisiones de su cuarto, cocina, lo que para el será sastifactorio para una mejor comodidad familiar.
texts.en:
Pablo is 51 years old and has two children. For several years, he has worked as a bricklayer, a job he learned when he was young. He has also worked in security for private companies. Currently he watches a house at night to earn a little more money since construction jobs are scarce at times. He has few economic resources, and with his small earnings he built his house of concrete, but it still lacks improvements, and what he wants to do first is to tile the living room for better hygiene. To do this, he will buy sand and cement to start the work. In the future, he wants to put walls around his bedroom and kitchen, which would make the family more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sand and cement to tile the living room of his house

loans.name: C2718 Dutsindubukene Group

texts.en:
Jean Damscene is 32 years old and is married with three children who are 2, 3 and 6 years old. He is the president of a group called “Dutsindubukene” and this group is commonly known in the business of selling bananas. This is their third successful year in this business, which they operate from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Jean Damscene and his team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for a purpose of increasing the quantity of bananas they sell to the market. With this expansion, this group really hopes that the earned profits will increase, as they will be able to satisfy the demand of their customers. In addition, each member of the group will start saving and be able to satisfy the basic needs of his/her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old, married, and has four children. She is a happy and hardworking woman who is very industrious. She is also happy because she is a grandmother.
Esther sells medicines to make a living. She has been in this business for a long time. She loves her business because of the profits that she makes from it. In the future, she hopes to own a big pharmacy store. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 NGN to purchase more medicines to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: La Paz 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Roseline is the coordinator of her group La Paz 1,2 (The Peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is based around the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Roseline makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their five children.
Roseline is excited to be taking her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, and starting to invest in her business selling clothing and shoes. She plans to use this loan to purchase boxers, undershirts and sandals in the main markets in the capital to sell in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to provide her family's basic necessities and to save towards her dream of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sandals, undershirts and boxers for resale

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 40 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a businessman and they live together in Lagos State, Nigeria. Helen is a well-known trader in her community. For many years, she has been buying and selling foodstuffs such as semolina, tomato paste, fufu (made from cassava), beans and more in her shop in Lagos. She works hard to make sure there is food on the table for her children. She opens her shop every day of the week in order to make more sales.
Helen is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to buy more foodstuffs such as semolina, tomato paste, fufu, beans and more in large quantity as this will attracts more discounts. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell, such as semolina, tomato paste, fufu and beans

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 30 years old and is married with three children aged 2, 4 and 6 years. He is commonly known as a self-employed businessman selling a large quantity of beer. He has been in this business for about three years and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 7 p.m. every day.

Jean Bosco needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company with a target of expanding his business through adding soda to his inventory. With the use of this loan, He hopes to start wholesaling to the retailers.

Jean Bosco, with this business expansion, hopes that he will earn more profits, which in turn will be used for further reinvestment, for taking care of his family, and to start saving for their future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of beer

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es:
María Luisa D. es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Caminantes  que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Juan Pablo, tiene 48 años y es vecina de la ciudad de El Alto, específicamente vive en la zona Villa Esther, hace 6 meses.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de alimento seco, como arroz, fideo, trigo, harina, azúcar y otros, desde hace 12 años aproximadamente.

Las demás integrantes de esta  Asociación tienen actividades económicas como confección de vestidos, venta de comida, cosméticos, ropa, api, condimentos, frutas y artesanía.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir y mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa D. is part of the community group Caminantes, which is part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center. Maria is 48 years old. Six months ago she moved to Villa Esther, near the city of El Alto. For about 12 years, she has been selling dry goods including rice, noodles, wheat, flour, sugar, etc. The other members of this group make and sell clothing, food, api (a rice drink), cosmetics, spices, fruits and crafts. They will all use their loan to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Juani

texts.es: LA SRA. JUANI ESTA CASADA TIENE HIJOS YA MAYORES, VIVE SOLO CON SU ESPOSO, LA CLIENTE SE DEDICA  A LA VENTA DE COMIDA  TIENE MAS DE 20 AÑOS DE ANTIGUEDAD Y DE EXPERIENCIA , CUENTA CON UN PUESTO EN EL MERCADO CENTRAL DE SACABA QUE ESTA UBICADO A UN CUADRA DE LA PLAZA PRINCIPAL. ES UN MERCADO MODERNO Y NUEVO ESTA UBICADA EN EL SECTOR DE COMIDAS, TIENE BASTANTES CLIENTE QUE FRECUENTAN EN SU NEGOCIO . TIENE CASA PROPIA ES DE CLASE HUMILDE Y SENCILLA. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA ES PARA MEJORAR EL NEGOCIO COMPRAR NUEVAS OLLAS , MESAS Y SILLAS PARA MEJORAR SU PUESTO, LA SRA. JUANI ESMUY TRABAJADORA DESDE MUY NIÑA TRABAJO EN LA VENTA DE COMIDAS, CUENTA QUE LE GUSTA COCINAR QUE CADA PLATO LO PREPARA CON MUCHO CARIÑO PARA SUS CLIENTES, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
La señora Juani is married, and her children are adults. She lives alone with her husband. She has more than twenty years of seniority and experience selling food. She has a food stall in the central market, located one block from the main plaza. The market is new and modern. Her stall is located in a food court, and she has many customers. The home that she owns is humble and simple. She is applying for a loan to improve her business, to buy new pots, tables, and chairs. La señora Juani is a very hard worker. She has sold food since she was a young girl. She says that she likes to cook and that she prepares each dish for her customers with much affection. She is very grateful to Emprender (local lending institution) and Kiva for the trust they have displayed by loaning money to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables and chairs

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa es una mujer muy trabajadora, de edad de 55 años, procreo cinco hijos el cual tuvo que trabajar mucho para poder sacarlos adelantes con lo necesario. Con ayuda económica  de ellos productos de sus trabajo logro poner una pulpería ya lleva varios años en su venta  en donde con las ganancia cubre sus gastos personales como paga de gastos básicos.
También por las noches logra vender, fritanga como: enchiladas, tacos, tajada con queso, pollo asado, carne asada, y ha logrado hacer clientela, con el propósito de poder ahorrar para hacer su casa con mejor seguridad ya que parte la tiene forrada con zinc. 
Con este financiamiento invertirá en frijoles, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabones, golosinas, cereales, gaseosas, productos lácteos. Carne, pollo entre otros para lograr aumentar su inventario como sus ventas, con el fin de ofrecer un mejor servicio. Con estos prestamos se ha beneficiado en el crecimiento de su pequeño  negocio, lo cual esta contenta por que logra ayudar a sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en:
Josefa is a very hardworking woman. She is 55 years old and the mother of five children. She has had to work very hard to be able to get them ahead with every thing they need. With their economic help from their jobs she was able to start a grocery store. She has had it for several years. The profits cover her personal and basic expenses. In addition, at night she sells fried foods such as: enchiladas, tacos, pizza slices, and roasted chicken. She has been able to build up a clientele. Her reason for doing this is to be able to make her house safer, since part of it is only sided with zinc. She will invest this loan in beans, rice, sugar, oil, snacks, ceral, sodas, dairy products, meat, and chicken among other things in order to grow her inventory and her sales. She is doing this in order to offer better service. These loans have benefitted the growth of her small business and she is happy to be able to help her children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy food to grow her inventory, such as:  rice, beans, sugar, oil, snacks and dairy products among others.

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: Née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, F. Léa est mariée à KOBITI Martial, un mécanicien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Léa vit avec ses enfants et son mari à Fifadji, un quartier de Cotonou. C’est depuis huit ans que Léa s’est installée dans ce quartier. Léa vient en aide à son mari en ce qui concerne les différentes charges de la famille. Léa n’a jamais été à l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Léa a commencé la vente de maïs et d’huile d’arachide dans son quartier. Léa s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Léa a déjà bénéficié de deux prêts de ALIDé et qui ont tous été bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Léa sollicite un autre crédit, en vue d’augmenter son stock de produits et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Léa F. is married to Martial Kobiti, a mechanic. The couple have four children, all in school, of whom three are in their care. Léa lives with her husband and children in Fifadji, an area of Cotonou. It has been eight years since Léa began living in this area. Léa helps her husband in meeting the various needs of the family. Léa never went to school. About four years ago, Léa begin selling maize and peanut oil in her area. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Léa has already benefited from two loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) and repaid both of them properly. Faced with the increasing demand of her customers, Léa is seeking another loan, with the goal of increasing her stock of products and better satisfying her clientele.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and cans of peanut oil

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: LA SRA. FELICIDAD  VIVE EN LA  ZONA VILLA OBRAJES, ES SU CASITA PROPIA, ES CASADA TIENE 5 HIJOS LOS DOS TRABAJAN DURO PARA MANTENER EL HOGAR YA QUE CON 5 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR NO LES ALCANZA EL DINERO, ES DE CLASE HUMILDE Y SENCILLA, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y SACRIFICADA, SE DEDICA A VENDER COSAS USADAS COMO POR EJEMPLO ROPA Y OTRAS COSAS USADAS QUE COMPRA AVECES VISITANDO CASA POR CASA Y DESPUES LOS VENDE A UN PRECIO MAS ELEVADO, ELLA TIENE SU PUESTOS DE VENTA DONDE COMERCIALIZA SUS PRODUCTOS. EL CREDITO SOLICITA PARA AUMENTO DE CAPITAL PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA Y SU ESPOSO ES ALBAÑIL TIENE CONTRATOS Y CUANDO NO TIENE TRABAJO CUIDA A SUS HIJITOS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA QUE LES DA ESTA OPORTUNIDAD EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Felicidad lives in her own little house in the Villa Obrajes zone. She is married and has five children. She and her husband work hard to take care of their home since with five school-age children they don't have enough money. Felicidad comes from humble and simple people. She is very hard-working and self-sacrificing. She sells used things like, for example, clothing and other used things that she buys, sometimes by visiting house to house, and later she sells them at higher prices. She has spots where she sells her products. She is asking for this loan to increase her capital so she can buy more merchandise. Felicidad's husband is a bricklayer. He has contracts, and when he has no work, he takes care of the children. They are both very grateful to Emprender and Kiva, who have given them this opportunity by giving them the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: LA SRTA. CAROLINA VIVE EN LA ZONA DE HUAYLLANI QUE ESTA UBICADO A UNA CUADRA ANTES  DE LA TRANCA HUAYLLANI, ES LA CASA DE SU MAMA , TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO DONDE TIENE UNA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES Y OTROS, TAMBIEN TIENE DOS CABINAS DE LLAMADAS A CELULARES, ES LA UNICA TIENDA POR EL LUGAR, POR ESTA RAZON TIENE MUCHOS CLIENTES Y ES MUY CONOCIDA EN EL SECTOR, ES SOLTERA NO TIENE HIJOS, CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD SOSTIENE A SU FAMILIA Y TAMBIEN LE AYUDA EN SUS ESTUDIOS, ELLA ESTUDIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD, ES UNA PERSONA RESPONSABLE Y TRABAJADORA CON GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE, CON GANAS DE MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA, EL CREDITO SOLICITA PARA AUMENTO DE CAPITAL PARA PODER SURTIR SU TIENDITA CON MAS PRODUCTOS. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Srta. Carolina lives in the Huayllani zone, which is located one block before the Huayllani checkpoint, in her mother's house. She has a neighborhood store where she has a variety of food and other products. She also has two booths for cellular phone calls. It is the only store in that area, so she has many customers and is well known in the district. She is single and has no children. With this activity she supports her family and it also helps her with her studies. She studies at the university. She is a responsible and hard-working person with the desire to advance herself and improving the quality of life of her whole family. She is applying for a loan to increase her capital to be able to stock her little store with more products. She is very thankful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence offered in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda tiene 48 años, ella vive al lado de sus hijos Sayra de 27 años, Jorge de 22 años y Nayeli de 08 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 meses se dedica a vender Golosinas, actividad que le ayuda a disponer de su tiempo para atender a su última hija que esta en edad escolar y que aún necesita de su apoyo. es por ello que este negocio, es la actividad perfecta para trabajar y dedicarse a  su familia, e esa manera su día de trabajo empieza con la labores del hogar durante las mañanas y por la s tardes sale a ofrecer su mercadería de forma ambulatoria, situándose algunas veces en el mercado de su zona y otras visitando a sus vecinas ofreciendo sus ricas golosinas. Ella se siente contenta con su trabajo y espera poder continuar así hasta que pueda tener su propia tienda de abarrotes. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos, ya que para él, la responsabilidad es lo primero. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más mercadería en dulces, galletas para que pueda aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old. She lives with her children, Sayra (27), Jorge (22) and Nayeli (8). They all live together in their own house. For three months Yolanda has sold sweets, a job which has allowed her to have time to take care of her youngest child, who is still school-age and needs her support. This business is perfect both for working and for taking care of her family. Her work day begins with housework in the mornings, and in the afternoons she goes out to offer her merchandise as a traveling saleswoman, sometimes setting up at the market in her area and sometimes visiting her neighbors to offer them her delicious sweets. She is happy with her work and hopes to continue it until she can have her own grocery store. This is Yolanda's first loan from MFP, and she promises to be very punctual with the payments, since responsibility is most important for her. With the loan, she will buy more candies and cookies so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cookies and candies to stock her sales stand

loans.name: C5252 Seeds Of Vision Group

texts.en:
Adeline is 28 years old and is married with three children. She is the president of a team called “Seed Of Vision” and this group is commonly known in the business of selling a variety of goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, and some other goods usually sold in a shop.

Adeline and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business with the target of wholesaling to the retailers who operate the same business.

With this business expansion, Adeline and her team will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow each member of the group to start saving for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, and some other goods

loans.name: Djikiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djikiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 28  ans, 3   enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, d’habits, de volailles, de poissons, de cosmétiques, et de la restauration.                                                                                      
Ces femmes du groupe Djikiya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments alimentaires, du poisson fumé, des habits pour enfants, des produits cosmétiques et des volailles.
Mama S. qui est dans le créneau de la volaille compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des pintades, des canards et des poulets destinés à la vente.                                          
Elle s’approvisionne en volailles avec les fournisseurs des villages environnants  et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Konobougou et avec les revendeurs venus d’ailleurs, au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
All the women of the group Djikiya are married and average 28 years of age and three children each living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, sub- prefecture of Barouéli, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through ties of community and kinship. And they run businesses involving condiments, clothing, poultry, cosmetic, and food catering.  The women in the group are on their first solidarity loan, which will be used for buying condiments, smoked fish, children's clothing, cosmetics, and poultry.  Mama S., whose niche is in poultry, intends to use her loan for buying Guinea fowl, ducks, and hens to be sold.  She supplies herself with poultry from suppliers from surrounding villages. And she sells locally, at the Konobougou market, to retailers from elsewhere.  She accepts cash from a customer base composed of women and men.  She plans on making an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the businesses. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying poultry

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: LA SRA. OLGA TIENE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO DONDE VENDE VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS ENTRE ELLOS PAN ,REFRESCOS, GALLETAS , ABARROTES Y OTROS. ESTA CASADA, SU ESPOSO TIENE UN CAMIONETA PRESTA SERVICIOS HACIENO FLETES DEL TRANSPORTE DE MERCADERIA, TIENE UNA HIJA MENOR QUE TIENE 12 AÑOS QUE SE ENCUENTRA EN EDAD ESCOLAR. SU TIENDITA ESTA UBICADO EN BUEN LUGAR EN LA AV. BARRIENTOS EN EL CENTRO DE LA CIUDAD DE COCHABAMBA. EL CREDITO QUE SOLICITA A EMPRENDER ES PARA PODER SURTIR MAS SU TIENDITA YA QUE LE FALTA MAS PRODUCTOS. LA SRA. OLGA ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y MUY RESPONSABLE CON ESTA ACTIVIDAD AYUDA EN LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR A SU ESPOSO, SU DESEO DE LA SRA. OLGA ES DE VER  A SU HIJA PROFESIONAL, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Olga runs a neighborhood store where she sells a variety of products like bread, drinks, cookies, groceries, etc. She is married and her husband has a truck that he hires out to transport merchandise. They have a 12 year old daughter who is attending primary school. Her store is in a good locale on Barrientos Avenue in the center of the city of Cochabamba. The loan she is requesting is to better supply her store since she needs more inventory. Olga is very hardworking and very responsible. The money from her store is used to pay for household expenses. She dreams of seeing her daughter become a professional. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have in her to provide her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tièssiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne  36 ans,   5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, sous préfecture de Barouéli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels les céréales, l’habillement, les articles de boutique, les condiments alimentaires, les  cosmétiques  etc.                                                                                     
Ces femmes du groupe Tièssiri sont à leur premier prêt de groupe et Koumba C. qui est dans le créneau des condiments alimentaires compte utiliser son prêt pour  se constituer un stock  de divers condiments alimentaires, le plus généralement à Bamako auprès des grossistes  et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Konobougou et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.                                 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
All the women of the group Tièssiri average 36 years of age and five children each living in traditional extended families in Konobougou City, sub-prefecture of Barouéli, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another though ties of community and kinship. And they do business in a variety of goods, such as grains, clothing, boutique items, condiments, etc. The women in the group are on their first group loan. Koumba C., whose niche is in condiments, intends to use her loan for building up a stock of various condiments, mostly in Bamako, from wholesalers. She sells locally, at the Konobougou market and at the surrounding fairs, and she accepts cash and credit from a customer base composed essentially of women and men. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying condiments

loans.name: C5257 Tebuka Group

texts.en:
Speciose is 26 years old and is married with two children and two dependents. She is the president of a group called “Tebuka” and this is their fourth successful year in the business of selling a variety of goods including spare parts, secondhand clothes, foodstuffs, etc. Their business hours are from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.

Speciose and her team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their business and build a small shop from which to operate their business. With the use of this loan, Speciose and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow each member of the group to start saving as well as building for a better future.

loans.use: To expand their business and build a small shop

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es cliente nueva quien se dedica a la confeccion y comercializacion D. prendas D. vestir especificamente chamaras D. tela kaki y piel D. durazno, tambien confecciona sacos D. tela polar y deportivos D. distinto material estos ultimos solo los elabora a pedido.  ella vive en casa propia la que se encuentra ubicada en la zona la Portada, la cliente vive con su hijo el cual le ayuda en los diseños D. bordados que llevan sus prendas D. vestir.  La comercializacion la realiza D. forma ambulante por la calle MancoKapac y en la feria 16 D. julio lugares conocidos donD. se asientan varios vendedores ambulantes que no tienen puesto fijo D. venta, venD. los dias jueves y viernes, el destino D. la inversion es la D. comprar telas Piel D. Durazno y Kaki para la confeccion D. chamarras. La sra. Maria es muy trabajadora siempre innovando en la confeccion D.  productos D. vestir, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Maria is a new Emprender customer who makes and sells items of clothing, specifically khaki jackets and smooth-skin jackets; she also makes custom thermal sports jackets from various materials. She lives in her own home located in the La Portada zone. She lives with her son who helps her with the designs and finishings of the articles of clothing. She sells her goods on foot on MancoKapac street in the July 16th market, places with many merchants who do not have a fixed storefront. She sells on Thursdays and Fridays. The loan will be used to buy more cloth to make her jackets. Maria is very hardworking and is always innovating with new products; she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (cloth)

loans.name: Lolo Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Lolo, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, de condiments et d’arachide.
Ces femmes du groupe Lolo sont à leur premier prêt solidaire et Wouleye F. qui s’est spécialisée dans le plastique, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique.
Elle s’approvisionne le plus généralement à Bamako et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the group Lolo are all married and average 40 years of age and five children each living in traditional extended families in Dioïla City in the region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship and community. And they do commerce in plastic kitchen utensils, condiments, and peanuts. The women in the group are on their first solidarity loan. Wouleye F., who became specialized in plastic ware, intends to use her loan for buying plastic kitchen utensils. She stocks up for the most part in Bamako. And she sells locally at the Dioïla market and at the surrounding fairs and accepts cash and credit from a customer base composed of women and men. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover day-to-day family expenses, and the rest will be reinvested in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying plastic ware

loans.name: Alya Dekemi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis plus de 10 ans déjà le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, son expérience dans ce commerce a fait qu’elle en a une parfaite maîtrise. Sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Actuellement elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour s’approvisionner avec 1 sacs de riz, 50 petits bidons d’huile, 1 carton de savons et 1 carton de sucre, divers.
texts.en:
This woman has run a business selling general food products for more than 10 years, and her experience has given her a mastery of this business. Her clientele is composed of all types of people. Currently, she is facing a shortage in her stocks of merchandise, which is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to supply herself with 1 bag of rice, 50 small cans of oil, 1 box of soaps, and 1 box of sugar and other items.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35  ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Glofia, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce de lait, de poissons, d’articles divers de boutique et d’arachide.                                                                    
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire et Bafou Traoré  est un des membres du groupe qui excelle dans l’achat vente de poissons sous plusieurs formes. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des poissons frais. Elle s’approvisionne en poisson sur place avec les pêcheurs du village  et effectue sa vente sur place aux revendeurs venus de Dioïla et dans les villages environnants, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.                                                   
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group, all married, are on average 35 years old with 5 children and live in traditional extended families in the town of Glofia, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through familial and neighbourhood relations, and sell milk, fish, peanuts, and various shop items. These women are on their second solidarity (group) loan, and Bafou Traoré is one of the group members who excels in the buying and resale of various types of fish. She intends to use her part of this loan to buy fresh fish. She gets her supplies of fish on-the-spot from the town fishermen and makes her sales locally to the retailers who come from Dioïla, and also in the neighbouring towns, in cash, at retail, and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, a portion of which will be used to pay for the family's daily expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA PAULINA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA, YA TRABAJA CON LA INSTITUCION HACE VARIOS AÑOS ES MUY RESPONSABLE EN EL PAGO D. SUS CUOTAS, ELLA ES DENOMINADA MAÑANERA YA QUE VEND. SUS PRODUCTOS DESD. TEMPRANAS HORAS D. LA MADRUGADA AL MAYOR Y AL MENOR EN UN MERCADO CON MUCHO MOVIMIENTO D. NUESTRA CIUDAD POR LA CALLE TUMUSLA, LAS MAÑANERAS SON UN GRUPO D. PERSONAS COMO SU NOMBRE LO INDICA VENDEN DESD. TEMPRANAS HORAS D. LA MADRUGADA PERO VENDEN PRODUCTOS POR MAYOR YA QUE EN LA MAYORIA D. LOS CASOS ELLAS LOS CONFECCIONAN SOLO VENDEN HASTA LAS 9 D. LA MAÑANA DESPUES LAS DESALOJAN YA QUE DOND. VENDEN NO SON SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA Y A LAS NUEVE EMPIEZAN A LLEGAR LAS DUEÑAS D. LOS PUESTOS, ELLA SOLO TRABAJA POR LAS MAÑANAS Y EN LAS TARDES SE DEDICA A LABORES D. CASA Y  COCINAR PARA  SU ESPOSO QUIEN LLEGA CANSADO TRAS UNA JORNADA LARGA D. TAXISTA. SE AYUDAN AMBOS YA QUE SUS HIJOS SON MAYORES Y VIVEN D. MANERA INDEPENDIENTE. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Paulina is a long-time Emprender customer, she has worked with the institution for many years and is very responsible in making her payments. She is called "morning person" as she sells her products both wholesale and retail early in the morning in a heavily trafficked market on Tumusla street. The "morning people" are a group of people who, as their name says, sell their goods early in the morning. They sell their goods wholesale since in most cases, they make their products and only sell until 9 am. After 9, the owners of the stores arrive and the "morning people" have to leave. Paulina only works in the morning but in the afternoon she takes care of her home and cooks for her husband who arrives tired after a long day of being a taxi driver. They help each other since their children are older and live indepedently. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing confidence in her by providing her this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Milagros De Cumyasa Group

texts.en:
Lourdes is the coordinator of her group, Milagros D. Cumyasa (Miracles of Cumyasa), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where the economy revolves around the sugarcane harvest, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and two children.
Lourdes is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small bakery by purchasing rice, salt and cooking oil. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business with the goal of making it a stable and established business in the community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase rice, salt and cooking oil

loans.name: Bintou Akosua

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a plus de 15 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce ce qui fait qu’elle est très connue dans son  quartier. Elle fait face à une diminution de son stock de marchandise raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter une quinzaine de pagnes. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman has run an income-generating business selling pagnes (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth), and her more than 15 years of experience in this field has led her to be very well-known in her area. She is faced with a shortage in her stock of merchandise, which is why she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy about 15 pagnes. She is married and has two children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (a type of printed West African cloth)

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
En esta Alcancía Comunal los socios se dedican al comercio lo que les permite mantener a sus familias, como es el caso D. Fidelia elL. venD. ropa en un puesto desD. que se formo un mercado en Huaycan hace varios años, todo el esfuerzo es por sus 4 hijos. ElL. tiene un sueño D. construir su puesto con otro tipo D. material que le permita estabilidad en su negocio.
Ana tiene un pequeño puesto D. ropa en el mercado con los pocos ingresos pueD. mantener a 2 hijos elL. desea invertir mas en su negocio y así obtener mayores ganancias. Con mucho esfuerzo y pensando en L. mejora familiar Josefina pudo aperturar un pequeño bazar y librería en el mercado aunque a veces no tienen muchos ingresos sabe que tiene que seguir trabajando para poder seguir subsistiendo. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
In this Communal bank the members all run businesses that allow them to support their families. One of these is Fidelia. She sell clothes from a store in a market since it was formed in Huaycan a few years ago. All this work is for her four children. She has a dream to build her store with other materials that will give her business stability. Ana has a small clothes store in the market, and with the small earnings she can support her 2 children. She wants to invest more in her business and thus improve her earnings. With much effort and thinking about family improvement, Josefina opened a small store and bookstore in the market. Even though sometimes she does not have much income, she knows she has to keep working to be able to keep surviving. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Gerrit Larsen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products and materials

loans.name: Faïda Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Faïda, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 35 ans, 2  enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Missiritou  préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de gâteaux et d’arachide sous plusieurs formes.
Ces femmes du groupe Faïda sont à leur premier prêt solidaire  et Alima Lassina C.  qui est dans le créneau des condiments alimentaires compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des colis de condiments (poudre de piment, sel de cuisine, Cube Maggie, de la pâte d’arachide, concentrée de tomates etc.) 
Elle s’approvisionne en condiments le plus généralement à Dioïla et à Fana et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Dioïla et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12500FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Faïda group, all married, are on average 35 years old with 2 children and live in traditional extended households in Missiritou, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through familial relations and run businesses selling food condiments, cakes, and peanuts in various forms. These women are on their first solidarity (group) loan. One of the members, Alima Lassina C., is in the business of selling food condiments and intends to use her portion of the loan to buy packets of condiments (pepper, table salt, Maggie cubes, peanut paste, tomato concentrate, etc.). She gets her supplies of condiments generally in Dioïla and in Fana, and makes her sales locally, at the market in Dioïla, and at the neighbouring market day fairs, in cash, at retail, and on credit, to a clientele composed of women and men. She intends to realize an average monthly profit of 12,500 FCFA, a portion of which will be used to pay for the family's daily expenses, and the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Hodo

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est célibataire, pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres besoins elle a commencé le commerce de détail de divers articles.  Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et exerce cette activité depuis 2006, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises. Voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter de l’encens, des bougies, des parfums et divers.
texts.en:
This young woman is unmarried, and began a business retailing various items in order to provide for herself. She gets her supplies in Lomé, and has run this business since 2006, selling to a clientele composed of all types of people. She is faced with a shortage in her stock of merchandise. Wanting to resupply herself, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy incense, candles, perfume, and other items.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy incense, candles, perfume, and other items

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Luis junto con su esposa tienen un taller Mecanico , el se dedica al arreglo de motores de vehiculo y en ocaciones de Chaperio de Vehiculos tiene Operarios a su cargo a los que les pagan por porcentaje. El Sr. Luis no cuenta con deudas en ninguna otra institucion y necesita el credito para remodelar su taller ya que le han ofrecido un contrato con una empresa grande y eso le generara muchos mas clientes e ingresos a la vez.  El taller se encuentra ubicado en el 4ºanillo entre centenario y Roca y Coronado, el Sr. Luis es una persona muy trabajadora desde muy pequeño empezo como ayudante de un taller mecanico de ahi aprendio su oficio y le esta enseñando a su esposa ya que ella le ayuda en taller mecanico, con el dinero del credito quiere refaccionar su taller, para ampliarlo ya que con el contrato que le ofrecio esta Empresa tendra muchos clientes, y asi tener mas ingresos que mucha falta le hace, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito..
texts.en:
Luis and his wife own an auto mechanic shop that repairs motor vehicles, and occasionally a full-service body shop is under his supervision for which they pay a percentage. Luis does not have debt at any other institution and needs the loan to remodel his auto mechanic shop. A large company has offered him a contract, and it will generate many more clients and revenue at the same time. The workshop is located on the 4th ring between Centenario and Roca and Coronado. Luis has been a very hardworking person since he was young. He started as an assistant in an auto mechanic shop where he learned his craft. He is now teaching his wife so that she can help him in the auto mechanic shop. With the loan, he wants to refurbish his shop and to expand it with the contract that has been offered by the large business. He will have many clients and thus have more revenue that he is lacking. He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodeling his auto repair shop

loans.name: Karin Arilmi

texts.es:
Karim, es conviviente y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Viven en casa propia, la cual 
adquirio con sus ahorros como comerciantes. Es una persona muy trabajadora y 
emprendedora; empezo vendiendo ceviche como ambulante en el mercado y ahora cuenta con 
dos negocios en local alquilado; uno de la venta de ceviche y otro de la venta de 
juguetes y accesorios femeninos(ganchos,   esmaltes, etc). Requiere el crédito para 
invertir en la compra de mercadería para la campaña del día de la madre. Su sueño es 
poder adquirir wen un futuro su local propio.
texts.en:
Karin lives with her partner and has two school-aged children. They live in their own home which they purchased with their savings from their jobs as salesmen. She is a hard-working and enterprising person; she started selling ceviche on foot in the market and now has two businesses in a rented space, one is her ceviche sales and the other is sales of toys and female accesories (hooks and nail polishes, etc.). She needs this loan to invest in more inventory for Mother's Day. Her dream is to someday own her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy vegetables and clothing wholesale

loans.name: Némè

texts.fr: Cette dame est une veuve et est mère de 3 enfants, afin de subvenir à leurs charges, elle s’est lancée en 2005  dans le commerce de céréales qui sont très utilisées dans la cuisine togolaise. Son dynamisme fait qu’elle gagne tous les jours de nouveaux clients. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays plus précisément dans la ville de notsè. Voulant gonfler son stock de marchandises elle sollicite de WAGEs un crédit pour l’achat  de 8 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs d’haricots , 1 sac et demi de mil et assurer le transport de la marchandises.
texts.en:
This lady is widowed with 3 children and, in order to provide for her family, began a business in 2005 selling cereals that are widely used in Togolese cuisine. Her energy has resulted in her earning new clients everyday. She gets her supplies in the interior of the country, more specifically in the town of Notsè. Wanting to increase her stocks of merchandise, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 8 bags of maize, 3 bags of beans, and one-and-a-half bags of millet, and to pay for the transportation of these goods.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Vecinas Unidas 4,5,6 Group

texts.en:
Regina is the coordinator of her group, Vecinas Unidas (United Neighbors), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsuL., an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple, rented structure with her long-term partner and two children.
Regina is excited to be taking her second loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry by purchasing earrings, necklaces and bracelets for her store. She will use the profits to purchase medicine, school supplies and a computer for her children. She will also save towards her dream of building her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase earrings, necklaces and bracelets for resale

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es: La Sra. Liliana, se dedica a la venta de dulces en un colegio y también se dedica a la venta de sabanas, su esposo trabaja de chofer interdepartamental de flotas, tienen 3 hijos los cuales van a colegio, La señora emprendió este negocio haces un  año,  actualmente ahora la señora se encuentra trabajando para salir adelante y sacar profesionales a sus tres hijos que aun se encuentran en el colegio. Clienta antigua en la institución de credito individual es muy trabajadora y no tubo problemas en el pago de sus cuotas, con esta actividad ayuda en los gastos de casa, y hace el trabajo de Padre y Madre, ya que por su trabajo su esposo para siempre fuera de la ciudad y ella sola se encarga de la educacion y bienestar de sus hijos, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor de sabanas, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Liliana sells sweets in a school, and also sells bed sheets. Her husband works as a long-distance bus driver. They have 3 children who are in school. Liliana started up this business a year ago. Now she is working to get ahead and help her children, who are still in school, become professionals. She is a longtime client of this institution (who has borrowed as an individual, rather than a group.) She is very hardworking and has not had problems making her payments. Her business helps her to pay the household expenses. She has had to take on the role of father and mother, since her husband is always away from the city due to his work, leaving her in charge of the education and welfare of their children. With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise (bed sheets) at wholesale. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in the granting of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise (bed sheets)

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal EL ROSARIO cursa el ciclo 11 y tienen como objetivo el bienestar familiar, Celinda alquila maquinaria pesada, para trabajos D. campo ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales su dedicación es uno D. ellos ya que padece D. una discapacidad. El crédito lo usara para el mantenimiento D. sus maquinas y así poder alquilar en mejore precio y obtener mayores ganancias.
Maria se dedica al trabajo D. costura en un taller hace 2 años eso le permite pagar los gastos en casa además los fines D. semana ofrece otros productos que le generan ingresos extras.
Luis trabaja D. operario en una carpintería fabricando casas D. madera pero su objetivo es abrir una bodega y restaurant que le permite apoyar a su madre aunque el es soltero y no tiene carga familiar desea estudiar para ayudar a su familia.
El grupo agradece a todas las personas por el crédito.
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
The community group "El Rosario" is in its 11th loan cycle and its main goal is the families' welfare. Celinda rents heavy machinery that is used to work the fields. She is married and has four children, one of whom has special needs. She will use her loan for the machines' maintenance so that she can rent them at a higher price and make more profits. María is a seamstress and has had a workshop for the last two years. Her work allows her to maintain her household. On weekends, she sells other products to make extra money. Luis works as a carpenter making wooden houses, but his goal is to open a restaurant and bar; with this business, he will be able to support his mother. Although he is single and does not have a family of his own, he wants to study to help his extended family. The group thanks everyone for the loan. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying goods for sale

loans.name: María Judith

texts.es:
María Judith  D. es socia del banco comunal  San Pedro ubicado en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre en  la parroquia Victoria de  Portete en la parte suroccidental del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte con la parroquia Tarqui, al este la parroquia Cumbe, al sur la periferia del cantón Girón y al oeste  la parroquia San Gerardo del  cantón Girón y la parroquia Baños. Es un encantador lugar donde se levanta  un hermoso monumento en honor a los héroes de la Batalla de Tarqui, en este lugar se libró la batalla entre los ejércitos ecuatoriano y peruano, nuestro ejército estuvo comandado por el Gral. Antonio José de Sucre.

María tiene 58 años, casada y con ocho hijos de ellos cuatro son casados y los otros cuatro son  solteros y viven con ella,  su esposo y dos nietos de los cuales se hizo cargo, su cónyuge  trabaja como estibador y sus  hijos de manera independiente pero sólo para solventar sus gastos personales. Gracias al esfuerzo  y sacrificio de los dos ahora cuentan  con su casa propia

 Nuestra socia se dedica a agricultura actividad que realiza varios años, también cría cuyes, pollos, tiene ganado vacuno y la  leche  que obtiene de sus vacas es para su hogar así como algunos animales. Formó parte de éste grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras invitada por su hermana hace tres años, los préstamos obtenidos ha invertido en su hogar y con el nuevo  credito comprará cuyes, pollos y alimento para incrementar su criadero.

Su sueño es ver  a sus hijos superarse en todos los aspectos.
texts.en:
María Judith D. is a member at the communal bank San Pedro, located in the community of San Pedro, Victoria de Portete parish, in the southeastern part of the Cuenca canton. It is a charming place where a heroes monument has been erected. María is 58 years old, is married, and has eight children, four of whom are married. The other four live with her, her husband, and two grandchildren of whom she takes care. María's husband is a longshoreman and her children work to cover their personal expenses. Thanks to María's and her husband's sacrifice, they now own their own home. María has worked in agriculture for several years. She also raises chickens, guinea pigs, and cows. Some of the animals and the milk her cows produce are for María's use at home. María became a member of this group of hardworking, fighting, and entrepreneurial women three years ago thanks to an invitation from her sister. The loans she has obtained she has used to better her home. With this new loan, she will buy guinea pigs, chickens, and animal feed. María's dream is to see her children succeed in all aspects of life.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens, guinea pigs, and feed

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 3 Group

texts.en:
Haidee is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Progreso (New Progress), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the lush, rugged Samana peninsula, an area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure as a single mother with her two children.
Haidee is excited to be taking her third loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry by purchasing merchandise to sell such as earrings, bracelets and necklaces. She will use the profits to invest in her children by purchasing a computer for them to learn on and by constructing a bathroom in her home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase necklaces, bracelets and earrings to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos M. esta soltero, tiene 21 años de edad, solo curso estudios hasta el nivel primario, desde muy pequeño ayuda a sus padre quienes se dedican al engorde de ganado vacuno para su comercialización, de donde fue ganando experiencia en la actividad y llegando a hacer pequeñas inversiones que a la fecha le permiten tener 4 cabezas de ganado de su propiedad, es muy notoria las ganas e ímpetu que tiene para crecer económicamente, es para ello que pide el crédito, incrementar su hato y de esta forma ayudar a sus padre, independientemente además el muestra muchas ganas para continuar sus estudio y capacitarse en el cuidado y engorde de ganado.
texts.en:
Santos M. is single, is 21 years old, and attended only primary school. Since he was a little boy, he's helped his father with the business of fattening cows to then sell. Santos has gained experience in this activity, making small investments that now allow him to keep four cows in his property. Santos' drive to grow the business is obvious. He is asking for a loan to increase the number of cows he keeps in order help his father. Santos would also like to continue studying and become better at fattening cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying livestock

loans.name: Gilmar

texts.es:
El Sr. Gilmar P. Guzmán tiene 42 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, esta casado hace 18 años, en vista al numero de hijos que tiene la casa le resulta muy pequeña para que estén cómodos motivo por el cual solicitan un crédito para la ampliación de la vivienda, al tener ingresos mínimos con el servicio de transporte le resultaría imposible realizar seméjate inversión. 

El nos cuenta que su mayor desea es en un futuro poder ampliar su casa de tal manera que todos sus hijo puedan vivir comodamente, y no sufran por falta de casa como el lo hizo.
texts.en:
Gilmar P. Guzmán is 42 years old, has six children, and has been married for 18 years. Because of the number of children he has, his house is too small for them to be comfortable. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to add on to his home. His income from his taxi business is low, so it is impossible for him to carry out this project alone. He says that his greatest desire for the future is to be able to add enough space to his house that all his children can live comfortably and not suffer from a lack of adequate housing as he did.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements and expansion

loans.name: Los Angeles De Alavarado Group

texts.es:
LA SRA. HAYDEE TOMASA; TIENE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD Y TIENE UN HIJO PEQUEÑO, ELLA FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO "LOS ANGELES DE ALVARADO" INTEGRADO POR NUEVE PERONAS, QUIENES VIVEN EN EL DISTRITO DE COMAS. SUS COMPAÑEROS LA ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO.
LA SRA. HAYDEE TOMASA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA EN UN PUESTO DEL MERCADO DE LA ZONA DONDE VIVE; EMPEZÓ VENDIENDO SANDALIA Y ZAPATILLAS, LUEGO FUÉ AUMENTANDO SU MERCADERÍA E INCURSIONÓ EN LA VENTA DE ROPA;SIEMPREM APROVECHA LOS CAMBIOS DE TEMPORADA.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO CANCELAR ALGUNAS DEUDAS QUE TENÍA, PUEDE PAGAR LA PENSIÓN DEL COLEGIO DE SU HIJA Y ASUMIR ALGUNOS GASTOS PERSONALES.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO, LO UTILIZARÁ PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MERCADERÍA PARA AUMENTAR SU STOCK.
texts.en:
Sra. Haydee Tomasa is 31 years old and has a young son. She is part of a group called “Los Angeles de Alvarado”, made up of nine people who live in the district of Comas. Her partners have selected her as the president of the group. Sra. Haydee Tomasa sells clothing in a market stall in the neighborhood where she lives. She started selling sandals and slippers, then expanded her merchandise to include clothing sales. She always takes advantage of seasonal changes. Through the success of her work, she has been able to pay off some debts that she had. She can now pay for her daughter’s school tuition and take care of some personal expenses. She will use the requested loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to improve her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Amados Por Dios Group

texts.es:
Amados por Dios es una Alcancía Comunal conformado por 9 socios que residen en un asentamiento Huamano D. Chosica, ellos están agradecidos por los prestamos.
Rayda se dedica  al tejido hace 2 años ella utiliza hilos lanas con los que hace polos, chompas vestidos y ropa D. bebe. Además enseña a otras personas a tejer y tener un ingresos extras. Rayda tiene 1 hijo por el cual debe D. seguir trabajando. Ella esta conforme con los prestamos ya que podrá invertir en la compra D. materiales para sus tejidos.
La tesorera del grupo Elvira trabaja en su casa y se dedica a diferentes negocios como son la venta D. verduras , la venta D. comida y los fines D. semana hace comidas especiales que le solicitan sus clientes. Ella tiene 7 hijos que la ayudan con el trabajo ya que saben que los ingresos son para toda la familia.
Este su tercer préstamo y las socios son mas responsables y saben que su puntualidad en los pagos es beneficio para todos.
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
Amados por Dios is a community bank maintained by 9 members who live in the settlement of Huamano D. Chosica; they appreciate the loans. Rayda knits and for two years she has used wool thread to make polo shirts, sweaters, dresses, and baby clothes. She also teaches others to knit for extra income. Rayda works to support her son. She's happy about the loans because she'll be able to invest in the purchase of materials for her knitting. Elvira, the treasurer of the group, works in her house and in various businesses such as selling vegetables and food. During the weekends she makes special food to order for her customers. She has 7 children who help her with the work because they know that the income is for the entire family. This is her third loan and the responsible members know that her punctual repayment benefits the group as a whole. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.es: Rogelia es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 48 años, vive con dos de sus hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de dos años, se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto que tiene dentro de unos de los mercados más concurridos de la zona en la que vive. Rogelia se siente muy contenta con su trabajo, debido a que le gusta cocinar, además esta actividad la mantiene ocupada todo el día y más en las mañanas que es el tiempo que más público va a su establecimiento a consumir sus platillos, al termino de la jornada ya solo se dedica a su hogar. En todo este tiempo, ha aprendido a ser perseverante hasta alcanzar sus metas, por tal motivo desea ampliar su local y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, disponiendo de mesas y sillas. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos, como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, condimentos, que son necesarios para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Rogelia is a hard-working woman, age 48, who lives with two of her children in her own house. More than two years ago, she began selling food from a stall she operates within one of the most popular markets of her area. Rogelia is very happy with her work, since she likes to cook; in addition, this activity keeps her busy all day, especially in the mornings, when the highest numbers of customers come to buy her food. At the end of the day, she takes care of the housework. Throughout this time, she has learned to persevere until she reaches her goals. In this spirit, she wants to expand her food stall and offer better service to her customers by providing more tables and chairs. This is her third loan with MFP, and she has always been very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is currently requesting, she will buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles and condiments which are necessary to prepare the dishes she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying basic ingredients to prepare the food she sells
